page.title: 05SALESIAN SCHOOL:BLAISDON
page.content: Blaisdon Hall was built in 1876 by Edwin Crawshay.It has had various owners, Peter Stubbs, Mr McIver. For a short spell no-one lived in it and it was used as a country club. In{1933}at an auction{Fr.Tozzi and Bishop William {Lee}purchased the land and buildings for Â£3,000. They opened the Hall as the{Salesian School}of Agricultural and Allied Trades. Boys of thirteen and fourteen, mostly orphans, stayed there and learned carpentry,shoe making horticulture and engineering. In 1950 it changed to a special school for boys with educational or emotional difficulties.New buildings were added in 1965. In addition to a normal education there are facilities for sport,trips etc at weekends. The care staff are all from the Salesian order.
